resources.string: What are the rules for equals and hashCode methods?
What is the difference between static and non-static fields?

If you override equals, you should also override hashCode.

If hash codes are different, the objects are definitely different.

If hash codes are the same, the objects may still be different.

Static fields and methods are associated with the class in which they are declared. You don\'t need to create an object (instance of a class) to refer to them.\nNon-static class members are associated with an object, so you must create an instance of a class to refer to them.
